intro: Chamaesyce minbuensis, commonly known as the Minbu sandstem, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, alternate leaves. It produces clusters of tiny, greenish-yellow flowers that are often surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia. Chamaesyce minbuensis is typically found in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments.
